segment.source: Manage corporate devices (Windows 10)
segment.target: Manage corporate devices (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can use the same management tools to manage all device types running Windows 10 desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.
segment.target: You can use the same management tools to manage all device types running Windows 10 desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.

segment.source: Manage corporate devices
segment.target: Manage corporate devices

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: You can use the same management tools to manage all device types running Windows 10 : desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.
segment.target: You can use the same management tools to manage all device types running Windows 10 : desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.

segment.source: And your current management tools, such as Group Policy, Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), PowerShell scripts, Orchestrator runbooks, System Center tools, and so on, will continue to work for Windows 10 on desktop editions.
segment.target: And your current management tools, such as Group Policy, Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), PowerShell scripts, Orchestrator runbooks, System Center tools, and so on, will continue to work for Windows 10 on desktop editions.

segment.source: There are several options for managing Windows 10 on corporate-owned devices in an enterprise.
segment.target: There are several options for managing Windows 10 on corporate-owned devices in an enterprise.

segment.source: Identity and management options
segment.target: Identity and management options

segment.source: Your employees using devices that are owned by the organization can connect to Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
segment.target: Your employees using devices that are owned by the organization can connect to Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

segment.source: Windows 10 does not require a personal Microsoft account on devices joined to Azure AD or an on-premises Active Directory domain.
segment.target: Windows 10 does not require a personal Microsoft account on devices joined to Azure AD or an on-premises Active Directory domain.

segment.source: choose active directory or azure ad for identity
segment.target: choose active directory or azure ad for identity

segment.source: Active Directory join
segment.target: Active Directory join

segment.source: You can join a device running Windows 10 to an on-premises Active Directory domain after the first-run experience (sometimes called out-of-box experience or OOBE).
segment.target: You can join a device running Windows 10 to an on-premises Active Directory domain after the first-run experience (sometimes called out-of-box experience or OOBE).

segment.source: You can add devices running Windows 10 to your existing Active Directory infrastructure and manage them just as you've always been used to managing PCs running Windows.
segment.target: You can add devices running Windows 10 to your existing Active Directory infrastructure and manage them just as you've always been used to managing PCs running Windows.

segment.source: Desktop devices running Windows 10 that are joined to an Active Directory domain can be managed using Group Policy and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Desktop devices running Windows 10 that are joined to an Active Directory domain can be managed using Group Policy and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: The following table shows the management support for Windows 10 in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: The following table shows the management support for Windows 10 in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Azure AD join
segment.target: Azure AD join

segment.source: Devices joined to Azure AD can be managed using Microsoft Intune or other mobile device management (MDM) solutions.
segment.target: Devices joined to Azure AD can be managed using Microsoft Intune or other mobile device management (MDM) solutions.

segment.source: MDM infrastructure for Windows 10 is consistent across device types.
segment.target: MDM infrastructure for Windows 10 is consistent across device types.

segment.source: Configuration capabilities may vary based on device platform.
segment.target: Configuration capabilities may vary based on device platform.

segment.source: mdm options for mobile, desktop, and iot through device lifecycle
segment.target: mdm options for mobile, desktop, and iot through device lifecycle

segment.source: For flexibility in identity and management, you can combine Active Directory and Azure AD.
segment.target: For flexibility in identity and management, you can combine Active Directory and Azure AD.

segment.source: Learn about integrating Active Directory and Azure Active Directory for a hybrid identity solution.
segment.target: Learn about integrating Active Directory and Azure Active Directory for a hybrid identity solution.

segment.source: How setting conflicts are resolved
segment.target: How setting conflicts are resolved

segment.source: A device or user might receive policies from multiple sources, such as MDM, Exchange, or provisioning packages.
segment.target: A device or user might receive policies from multiple sources, such as MDM, Exchange, or provisioning packages.

segment.source: In any policy conflict, the most secure policy value is applied.
segment.target: In any policy conflict, the most secure policy value is applied.

segment.source: Policy settings take precedence over settings applied in a provisioning package.
segment.target: Policy settings take precedence over settings applied in a provisioning package.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Provisioning packages can be applied either during device setup or after setup for runtime configuration.
segment.target: Provisioning packages can be applied either during device setup or after setup for runtime configuration.

segment.source: For more information about runtime provisioning packages, see Configure devices without MDM.
segment.target: For more information about runtime provisioning packages, see Configure devices without MDM.

segment.source: When setting values that do not have a security implication conflict, last write wins.
segment.target: When setting values that do not have a security implication conflict, last write wins.

segment.source: When settings are configured from both a provisioning package and another configuration source, the non-provisioning package configuration source has higher priority.
segment.target: When settings are configured from both a provisioning package and another configuration source, the non-provisioning package configuration source has higher priority.

segment.source: MDM enrollment
segment.target: MDM enrollment

segment.source: Devices running Windows 10 include a built-in agent that can be used by MDM servers to enroll and manage devices.
segment.target: Devices running Windows 10 include a built-in agent that can be used by MDM servers to enroll and manage devices.

segment.source: MDM servers do not need to create a separate agent or client to install on devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: MDM servers do not need to create a separate agent or client to install on devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: For more information about the MDM protocols, see Mobile device management.
segment.target: For more information about the MDM protocols, see Mobile device management.
